archimate:Requirement.name: 4.52.10 Firewall protection control
archimate:Requirement.documentation: Firewalls should be protected against attack by: restricting administrator access to a limited number of authorised, skilled individuals, such as firewall adminis-trators (e.g. by using strict access con-trol mechanisms and strong authenti-cation) limiting administrator access to dedi-cated accounts that are only used for managing firewalls encrypting administrator access (e.g. by using secure management con-soles, secure remote login shells such as SSH or encrypted connections us-ing TLS, IPsec or equivalent) restricting administrator access to a central point (e.g. in a Network Oper-ations Centre (NOC) using a minimum number of firewall management con-soles) preventing information about them (e.g. the manufacturer and model of the firewall, and the version numbers of the operating system and security software) from being disclosed on the network.
